currentPost.title: From Planes, Trains and Automobiles to Laptops, Cellphones and Tablets
currentPost.excerpt: For many medical practices, it is difficult to bring in and continue treating the generation known as millennials. This untapped [ More.. ]
currentPost.content:
For many medical practices, it is difficult to bring in and continue treating the generation known as millennials. This untapped market makes up about 75.4 million people according to the Government Census in 2015. However, the census also states that millennials are much more diverse and use various forms of technology for seeking medical care as opposed to traditional methods. Fortunately, Doctor Genius has an event about how to reach this untapped market.

Marketing to millennials

With technological advances, more and more people use cellphones or tablets instead of their computer. At this point, laptops and traditional desktop computers are becoming less of a mainstay in homes. While having a website can help a medical practice reach potential patients, millennials are less likely to search the web and more likely to use social media and apps.

Thus, Doctor Genius is hosting the event: Marketing to Millennials on March 15, 2018 at the Residence Inn by Marriott Santa Clarita Valencia from 6:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m. with dinner included. This event can also add up to 3 CE credits for attendees. For more information on the event or to register, click here.

Medical professionals may not realize that 85 percent of millennials use a smartphone, which grants them access to web browsers, social media platforms, apps and more. Due to this, it is less likely that people will pull out their laptop or computer every night. Medical professionals need a mobile-first website that can adjust to the screen size of the device. Part of marketing to millennials involves reaching them on their highly-mobile digital platforms.

5 in 6 millennials connect to businesses via social media.

Reaching patients through other digital platforms

Social media may have started out as a platform for friends to communicate with each other, but has now become a platform for much more. Businesses of all kinds can use social media to reach out to loyal customers and new consumers with active posts. Medical professionals can link to their website through social media.

In fact, the PEW Research Center found in August of 2017 that two-thirds of Americans reported that they got at least some of their news from social media. People are seeking information on these platforms instead of searching for the specific medical service online. Our event will take the time to go over tips and techniques for utilizing these platforms to reach new patients. We can also offer methods for patient retention and maintaining these patients for years to come. If you are interested in this event, register today or call us for more information.

Doctor Genius

At Doctor Genius, we work with clients to expand their private practice by helping them reach, engage and convert consumers into new patients. By offering high-end web marketing services to medical and health professionals throughout the United States, we help clients gain more profit and build trustworthy relationships with patients to initiate sustainable practice growth.

We construct a website for your practice, establish an active online presence, build and constantly update social media profiles, help you build stronger connections with patients, streamline the appointment scheduling process, funnel traffic from search engines directly to your practice website and much more. To begin the process of increasing the success and presence of your practice, give us a call at 877-477-2311.

prevPost.title: Oh The Places They’ll Go: The Potential Patient’s Online Journey
prevPost.excerpt: The goal of a website for any private practice is to accurately summarize the services of a practice and offer [ More.. ]
prevPost.content:
The goal of a website for any private practice is to accurately summarize the services of a practice and offer patients easy means of reaching your practice to schedule an appointment. The journey of the potential patient usually begins with an internet search that factor in online reviews, what insurance guidelines the patient has to follow and geographical location. If a website does not cater to those search parameters, then the website will have trouble attracting a steady flow of new patients.

Understanding the patient’s journey

It is important to understand the mindset of the potential patient who is in need of dental care. While advertising specific types of services on a website can be beneficial, professionals need a website that can effectively display those services in an easy-to-navigate manner. Patients need to feel that they can trust what the website states to a certain degree. Thus, reviews about the medical practice hold a certain amount of influence over people.

For instance, Ryan Erskine highlights statistics in a Forbes article, which states that 90 percent of consumers read online reviews before visiting a business. While people may be able to sense when a review is fake or the individual is over exaggerating, there are still many people who trust reviews to a certain degree. Thus, having a website that links to reviews and having professionals recommend patients leave reviews will help to promote their practice.

While reviews are an important part of what people consider when searching for a practice, location also influences where they will go. Many people will merely type in the name of their city and the type of care they need to start the search. Fortunately, Doctor Genius can help ensure that a specific practice appears within the different map apps and for the search phrase, “City, Dentist.”

The Forbes article adds that 91 percent of adults use search engines online to find information on the web.

Proper website presentation

In order to stand out among the masses on Google search results, professionals need a quality website service that continues maintenance and updates to the website. Doctor Genius does both of these things and more, applying skills and necessary tools to the foundation of the website. At Doctor Genius, we build a website with the potential patient’s focus in mind. We know where to place the correct terms, information and content people want immediately.

Our team understands that when people are considering calling a medical practice, they are searching for the surface level of information. After finding the basic information, patients may begin to look at the rest of the website to find quality content that breaks down the practice’s services. While each patient is different, there tends to be a similar search routine for medical care. Insurance also plays a significant role in selecting a medical practice. We can help the professional determine how much or little about the subject they want to place on their website.

Call us for more information today.

nextPost.title: Start the New Year off Right Part III: Quality Content and Support on a Regular Basis
nextPost.excerpt: One aspect of websites that many people may not realize is the importance of continually posting new content on a [ More.. ]
nextPost.content:
One aspect of websites that many people may not realize is the importance of continually posting new content on a regular basis. While a post may not be necessary every day, it is important to have regular posts that display the website is active. Google sees this as a “freshness signal” that boosts your ranking and will be less inclined to put a website that only posted once in the last 6 months anywhere near the top of search results. Thus, custom blog posts can help to keep a website active.

Content marketing for a medical practice

By uploading content on a regular basis, the website can remain active and help a website be more present in Google searches. In fact, even social media can help to promote a practice. HubSpot finds that in 2017, around 74 percent of people say they use Facebook for professional purposes. While other forms of social media can also be effective, medical professionals can use a social media account to promote new content on websites.

At Doctor Genius, we can help create blogs to post on our clients’ websites each month. The number of blogs will vary per package but can all aim to achieve the same goal of promoting the client’s practice. We also understand how to craft blogs that utilize keywords to help promote a specific service or type of treatment from the client. The content that Doctor Genius posts on a website can also help bring in new patients and increase the conversion rate; the rate at which people click through a link to the website.

HubSpot states that in 2017, at least 53 percent of marketers stated that blog content creation was their top inbound marketing priority.

The necessary maintenance and support

We understand that while many dental practices provide the same general services, there are specialized services that only certain professionals offer. Thus, we can help customize the content to match those specific services. Our Support Team is available to help make changes to website content in order to help it function at its full potential.

Our content can also help bring in new patients to your practice. In fact, in 2016, Econsultancy found that only about 22 percent of businesses were satisfied with their conversion rates. With constant support and regular content uploads each month, we can help you rank higher in Google search results.

If you are interested in enhancing your website, give us a call today. We can help you and your practice start the New Year off right with an effective and efficient website.
